relevant_findings.General: Alert, afebrile, in no apparent distress

relevant_findings.Left Arm: Massive, nonpitting, non-tender edema with dark red macule (2-3 cm), yellow serous drainage, and paler erythema extending across the anterior thorax to the sternum; no axillary adenopathy palpable; ultrasound revealed diffuse inflammation without abscess.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On Day 2, the arm showed worsening edema and erythema.

relevant_findings.Left Arm: Edema considerably decreased, the lesion appeared as a circumscribed erythematous plaque (4.5 cm) with central eschar (<1 cm).

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement; significant edema resolved, and lesion appearance changed.

relevant_findings.Lesion: 2-cm black eschar at the center of the cutaneous lesion.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The lesion developed compositional changes, indicating disease progression.

relevant_findings.General: Clinical condition stable despite persistent mild hemolysis.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient's clinical stability achieved after earlier complications.
